intro: Myriocephalus biflorus, commonly known as the two-flowered myriocephalus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive two-flowered inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in tropical or subtropical regions. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth texture, while its flowers are bilaterally symmetrical and often display vibrant colors. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
